message.content:
A grasshopper is a type of insect that belongs to the family Acrididae.  
They have a long and slender body which is usually colored in shades of green or brown. 
They have large hind legs for jumping and short front legs for grabbing things.
Their body is covered in a hard exoskeleton which protects them from predators. 
Grasshoppers have two pairs of wings which are used for flight. 
They are found in a variety of habitats such as fields, meadows, and gardens. 
Grasshoppers are herbivores that feed on plants and sometimes can become a pest for farmers.
